results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions

results.title: Survival of spaceship earth
results.creator_credit: Dirk Summers and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: Fosters an understanding of the effects technological development and human population have had on the earth’s ecology. Features Hugh Downs, Margaret Mead, John D. Rockefeller III, Lady Barbara Ward Jackson, Harrison Brown, and Walter Orr Roberts. Narrated by Raymond Burr.

results.title: Survival in the hills
results.creator_credit: Christopher Were, Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at anyone who is responsible in any way for mountain safety, whether as a leader or merely for themselves. Covers topics including: things that can go wrong; all aspects relating to exposure; suitable food and drinks; how to get help map and compass work; detours; accidents and simple first aid; and a summary of helpful general rules

results.title: Surplus government asset
results.brief_description: This short narrated documentary is an experimental film study of the Sydney showgrounds- it’s history, and it’s current use during the Royal Easter Show. It studies the culture of the past and present, as well as how and why the Show attracts a huge amount of both city and country people to the grounds once a year. The film presents a different point of view of the grounds and the social context in which it functions.

results.title: Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Jacquelin Perske, Australian Film Commission and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Knowing their aspirations will come true is what separates teenage friends Narelle and Nancy from other dreamers. Together, they are going to make it big as a singer and a writer and get out of their current situation - high school, Melbourne, and move to America. All it takes is money. As the girls slip in and out of fantasy, reality becomes all the more unbearable as their parents try to separate them. Cast includes Louise Fox and Di Adams.

results.title: Supervise with care: three studies in worker supervision
results.brief_description: Describes three studies in worker supervision: expert workers who become annoyed when a supervisor takes notes of details without explanation; proper distribution of work among seniors and juniors brought about by discussion between supervisors and seniors; in placing junior workers, supervisors should consider their abilities.

results.title: Supermarkets and the farmer
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film about food and the food dollar examines its value for farmer, consumer and vendor. What control has the farmer over the price he gets? What control has the consumer over the price he pays? What does the supermarket give and what does it take? To answer these questions, some knowledgeable people are presented: heads of food-store chains, economists, farmers, housewives and small storekeepers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Superstars in concert
results.creator_credit: Peter Clifton, John Heyman and World Film Services
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Europe from 1964-1973 this historical documentary features some of the British and American rock music superstars of the 60s and early 70s at venues such as Hyde Park, the Isle of Wight, and various concert halls across Europe. It includes some amazing archival footage and behind-the-scenes action reflecting the culture and mood of the generation of the time and features performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Otis Redding, Cream, Blind Faith, Cat Stephens, Jimi Hendrix, Donovan, Joe Cocker, Ike and Tina turner, Pink Floyd, Rod Stewart. A baby-boomer’s nostalgia trip.
